newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentina sees stronger tax revenues in Jan.
newsitem.headline: Argentina sees stronger tax revenues in Jan.

text.p: Argentine tax collection is expected to reach $4.1 billion in January, a rise of 6.2 percent from January 1996 and 7.1 percent from December, Tax Policy Undersecretary Guillermo Rodriguez Use said Wednesday.
"The growth from December is due to an increase in employers' contributions and social security contributions," Use told reporters.
He said the year-on-year improvement was based on an expected $100 million rise in Value-Added Tax collection and a petrol tax hike boosting revenues by $150 million.
